tit.e: NUKATAKA no Kunimiyatsuko or Kokuzo NUKATA
tit.cmt: NUKATAKA→NUKATAに修正しました。 or Kokuzo NUKATAを削除しました。

sen.j: 額田国造（ぬかたのくにみやつこ・ぬかたこくぞう）は美濃国西部（または近江国東部）を支配した国造。
sen.e: NUKATAKA no Kunimiyatsuko or Kokuzo NUKATA is the leading local family that ruled the western part of Mino Province (or the eastern part of Omi Province) in ancient Japan.
NUKATA no Kunimiyatsuko (aka. Kokuzo NUKATA) was the leading local family that ruled the western part of Mino Province (or the eastern part of Omi Province) in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: NUKATAKA→NUKATAに修正しました。or Kokuzo NUKATA→(aka. Kokuzo NUKATA)に修正しました。文法を修正しました。is→was
sen.e: NUKATA no Kunimiyatsuko (aka. Kokuzo NUKATA) was the leading local family that ruled the western part of Mino Province (or the eastern part of Omi Province) in ancient Japan.

sen.j: 『国造本紀』によると彦訓服命の孫の大直侶宇命が成務朝に額田国造に任じられたとある。
sen.e: "Kokuzo hongi" (the original record of provincial governors) says that OOTADARO no Mikoto, a grandchild of HIKOKUNIBUKU no Mikoto, was appointed to NUKATAKA no Kunimiyatsuko or Kokuzo NUKATA (the head of the local government) by the Seimu Imperial Court.

Kokuzo hongi (the original record of provincial governors) says that OOTADARO no Mikoto, a grandchild of HIKOKUNIBUKU no Mikoto, was appointed to NUKATA no Kunimiyatsuko (the head of the local government) by the Seimu Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: NUKATAKA→NUKATAに修正しました。or Kokuzo NUKATA を削除しました。
sen.e: Kokuzo hongi (the original record of provincial governors) says that OOTADARO no Mikoto, a grandchild of HIKOKUNIBUKU no Mikoto, was appointed to NUKATA no Kunimiyatsuko (the head of the local government) by the Seimu Imperial Court.
The Nukata clan.
The Nukata clan.
The Nukata clan.
The title given by the Yamato Imperial Court was Atane.
sen.cmt: 「姓（カバネ）とは、古代日本のヤマト王権において、大王（おおきみ）から有力な氏族に与えられた、王権との関係・地位を示す称号である。」を参考に訳出。
sen.e: The title given by the Yamato Imperial Court was Atane.
The title given by the Yamato Imperial Court was Atane.

sen.j: 後には宿禰を与えられた者もいた。
sen.e: The title sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles) was given to some of the descendants.
The title sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles) was given to some of the descendants.
The title sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles) was given to some of the descendants.

sen.j: 和珥氏・粟田氏・真野氏などと同系。
sen.e: In the same line with the Wani clan, the Awara clan and the Mano clan.
In the same line with the Wani clan, the Awata clan and the Mano clan.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。Awara→Awata
sen.e: In the same line with the Wani clan, the Awata clan and the Mano clan.
Nukata no go, Ikeda District, Mino Province.
Nukata no go, Ikeda District, Mino Province.
Nukata no go, Ikeda District, Mino Province.
Or Sakata District, Omi Province.
Or Sakata District, Omi Province.
Or Sakata District, Omi Province.

sen.j: 現在の岐阜県池田町 (岐阜県)。
sen.e: Now Ikeda-cho, Gifu Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 岐阜県が重複しているため、括弧を省略。
sen.e: Now Ikeda-cho, Gifu Prefecture.
Now Ikeda-cho, Gifu Prefecture.
Or Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
Or Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.
Or Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture.

tit.e: Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)
Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)
Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)

sen.e: Unknown.
Unknown.
Unknown.

sen.j: 額田今足 ...... 平安時代の法律家。
sen.e: NUKATA no Imatari is a lawyer in the Heian period.
NUKATA no Imatari was a lawyer in the Heian period.
NUKATA no Imatari was a lawyer in the Heian period.
Doctor of law.
Doctor of law.
Doctor of law.

sen.j: 律令の注釈を公定することを請願し、『令義解』撰修の先駆けとなった。
sen.e: Making a petition that notes on the Ritsuryo codes should be formally established, he was the pioneer in editing "Ryo no gige" (a commentary on the Ritsuryo codes).
sen.cmt: 「撰修とは、書物を著すこと。また、編集すること」[『令義解』（りょうのぎげ）とは、833年（天長10年）に淳和天皇の勅により右大臣清原 夏野を総裁として、文章博士菅原清公ら12人によって撰集された令の解説書。]を参考に解説。
sen.e: Making a petition that notes on the Ritsuryo codes should be formally established, he was the pioneer in editing "Ryo no gige" (a commentary on the Ritsuryo codes).
Making a petition that notes on the Ritsuryo codes should be formally established, he was the pioneer in editing "Ryo no gige" (a commentary on the Ritsuryo codes).
